column4: I'm a Xen newbie. I'm following the guide on the help pages, but I can't figure out how to use the dvd or cd as source instead of having to download everything from the net. Can someone explain this? The guide I'm talking about is this one: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Xen
to use the cd or dvd as source, you can use the dvd of ubuntu or the alternate cd of ubuntu (not the live/desktop one)
can you elaborate on your previous comment?
not directly to the iso. you would either insert it into the drive then execute apt-cdrom add or something similar
oh, but I could refer to /media/cdrom for instance?

i think you would mount the device as inserted in the standard cd/dvd rom drive, then apt-cdrom add it          and if you had the iso you should be able to mount that          mount ./ubuntu-alternate.iso /media/cdrom -o loop   for example
but how do I use xen-tools with that=?
sorry i am not help with xen
yes i understood you were asking for some specific to setting up xen, which is not the support type of this channel. you were also asking for help regarding using a disc as a source
yes, as a source when installing a Xen guest virtual machine.. That's special.. But my previous message was private and not meant as critisism, but as a helpful comment. :)
I wouldn't have asked for help here if I hadn't read all available guides.
yes, but they aren't familiar with Ubunutu.
